Pengusaha RI Mulai Belajar Terapkan Blockchain di Usahanya
07 Nov 2019, 04:08 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin Indonesia) melalui Blockchain Center of Excellence and Education (BCEE) menggelar pelatihan bagi perusahaan nasional yang ingin menggunakan teknologi blockchain. Pelatihan ini merupakan tindak lanjut dari penyelenggaraan KTT Global Blockchain Investment 2019 Juli lalu.Lokakarya yang digelar ini merupakan angkatan pertama. Pelatihan ini sudah berlangsung sejak 5 November 2019 kemarin."Workshop ini akan memberikan gambaran bagaimana teknologi blockchain diterapkan di berbagai belahan dunia dan sikap negara atau otoritas pemerintahan menghadapi teknologi ini," kata Wakil Ketua Komite Tetap Teknologi Informasi Bidang Logistik dan Pengelolaan Rantai Pasok Kadin Hidayat Tjokrodjojo di Menara Kadin, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Pelatihan ini awalnya membahas secara umum tentang blockchain dan bagaimana blockchain sebagai sistem database telah diterapkan dalam berbagai sektor. Pelatihan ini juga membahas hal spesifik dan tematik berbasis studi kasus beberapa sektor ekonomi.Hari kedua, secara khusus membahas sektor industri dengan fokus pada sektor logistik dan kelautan. Selanjutnya, penerapan blockchain pada sektor pertambangan dan penerapan token. Hari ini pelatihan membahas khusus sektor perbankan dan asuransi.BCEE yang merupakan kerjasama Kadin Indonesia dengan Blockchain Asia Forum (BAF). Pelatihan ini mendatangi banyak pembicara seperti Ketua Blockchain Asia Forum (BAF) Vincent Choy dan CEO Vision Group Philip Wong.Simak Video "Pengusaha: Revisi UU KPK Tak Jadi Kendala Iklim Investasi di Indonesia"[Gambas:Video 20detik](das/fdl)

RI Entrepreneurs Start Learning To Apply Blockchain in their Business
Nov 7 2019, 04:08 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - The Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin Indonesia) through the Blockchain Center of Excellence and Education (BCEE) is holding a training for national companies that want to use blockchain technology. This training is a follow up of the 2019 Blockchain Investment Global Summit held last July. The workshop that was held was the first batch. "This workshop will provide an overview of how blockchain technology is implemented in various parts of the world and the attitude of the state or government authority to deal with this technology," said Deputy Chair of the Information Technology Standing Committee on Logistics and Supply Chain Management Kadin Hidayat Tjokrodjojo at Menara Kadin, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). The training initially discussed generally about the blockchain and how the blockchain as a database system has been applied in various sectors. The training also discussed specific and thematic issues based on case studies of several economic sectors. The second day, specifically discussed the industrial sector with a focus on the logistics and marine sectors. Furthermore, the application of the blockchain in the mining sector and the application of tokens. Today the training will discuss the banking and insurance sector specifically. CEE, which is a collaboration between Kadin Indonesia and the Blockchain Asia Forum (BAF). This training came to many speakers such as the Chair of the Blockchain Asia Forum (BAF) Vincent Choy and CEO of Vision Group Philip Wong.
